bwwExcerpt: It's pretty racy stuff--the man will stop at nothing, even gay baiting, while admitting "Love is a commodity I can't afford"--and the play's financial shenanigans seem very current in the age of Bernie Madoff, especially when you consider the suicide of Madoff's son.Â Despite all that, for a lot of Act One, Man and Boy comes off stuffy and talky.
